message.content:
cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.SY. 

The paper discusses the design and experimentation of a novel architecture of Recurrent Neural Network (RNN) that adopts a computational memory based on the concept of stigmergy. This falls under the category of Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE). The paper also discusses the use of the proposed architecture for supervised classification, which falls under the category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). The architecture is designed to coordinate deposit, removal, and classification activities, which involves learning and generalization, and hence falls under the category of Machine Learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the use of the proposed architecture for solving the MNIST handwritten digits recognition benchmark, which falls under the category of Computer Vision (cs.CV). Finally, the paper discusses the SM-RNN architecture, which involves the integration of stigmergy-based computational memory with RNNs, and hence falls under the category of Systems and Control (cs.SY).
